data.title: Jetex global expansion continues with first UK base in London
data.meta_description: Jetex will provide a range of exclusive services for private jet flyers at its first UK base of London Biggin Hill Airport
data.text:
Fixed-base operator Jetex has launched its first UK service at London-Biggin Hill Airport (BQH) welcoming private jet flyers to the UK’s capital.

The move into the UK market signals further expansion for the aviation company which already has a strong presence in Europe, including a private jet terminal at Paris–Le Bourget Airport (LBG).

Founder and CEO of Jetex Adel Mardini described the move into the UK aviation industry as a “natural evolution” for the company.

As well as providing executive terminal services at Biggin Hill, Jetex will also set up retail and entertainment areas plus flight support facilities for crew.

“We are pleased with our arrival in London. Jetex already has a strong presence in Europe with a flagship private jet terminal at Paris Le Bourget, and the new flagship Jetex London is a natural evolution of our operations,” the CEO explained.

Existing Jetex operations stretch across the globe including the US, Brazil, Singapore and China.

Launched in 2005 in Dubai, Jetex has seen rapid growth with more than 30 FBOs (Fixed Base Operations) and ground support stations on its portfolio.

Robert Walters, Commercial Director at London-Biggin Hill said he was “extremely proud” that Jetex chose the airport for its latest launch.

“Jetex is one of the most respected and acclaimed businesses in private aviation, with an ambitious growth roadmap that reflects our own,” he added.

Along with Farnborough Airport, Biggin Hill is among the most widely used by private jets arriving in the UK.
